section.title: Trial message still appears after activating license.
section.p: Even after a license has been activated, the trial version message still appears.

p.systemoutput: You are using an unlicensed and unsupported version of .... Please contact your Systems Administrator for information on how to obtain a valid license.
You are using a trial version of Evoq .... You currently have ... days remaining before your trial period expires.

step.cmd: Verify that your license is activated.

substep.cmd: Check that the invoice number for this installation appears in the list and that the Activated box is checked.

info.p: If the license is not activated,

ul.li: If the server does not have Internet access while the license is being activated on it, see Activate License Manually.

step.cmd: Did you use the correct license type?

info.p: An invoice for one Evoq product cannot be used to license a different Evoq product. Example: An Evoq Content invoice is invalid for Evoq Engage.

substep.cmd: Verify that the correct invoice number, email, and license type are used.

step.cmd: Was the site moved from one server to another?

info.p: If so, verify that the license is activated at both the server level and the IIS level. The Licensing FAQ contains more details on this and a guide to activating a license correctly.
While logged in as a Host, go to Tools Clear Cache.
Additional symptom: You might also see the following error linked to DotNetNuke.Professional.Application.ProApplication.CheckLicense():

p.systemoutput: String reference not set to an instance of a String.

substep.cmd: Verify that the following nodes exist in web.config (The date and license type may differ.):

ul.li:
Two licensing nodes:
<add name="Licensing" type="DotNetNuke.Professional.HttpModules.LicenseValidatorModule, DotNetNuke.Professional" preCondition="managedHandler" /> <add name="Licensing" type="DotNetNuke.Professional.HttpModules.LicenseValidatorModule, DotNetNuke.Professional" />

step.cmd: Are you running the application pool under a custom domain account in Microsoft .NET Framework 4?

substep.cmd: Verify that the Application Pool Identity account / domain user has a valid profile.
Verify that the profile is not read-only; otherwise, the license key is not decrypted and the trial version message is displayed.
